file_content.text: No, not yet.... You don't understand. You've destroyed everything you....
Never been happier to outlive someone. One death's too good for her.
Troubling, though. What she said before, about the president. Sounded too... honest.
I sensed no deceit when she spoke.
You might be right.
She's gone. Whatever plans she had are over.
Maybe it doesn't matter.
The first lesson any Sith learns is that treachery leads to opportunity.
Honest? A Darth?
Instincts for trouble keep me alive.
I can get President Galthe back to the safe house, start his thaw. Meet me there.
And be quick. Something's not right.
More meddling in my affairs. This is beyond tiresome, "Zenith."
I decreed that Balmorra would not become a forced-labor world, and my reward? Your insolent little rebellion.
Now this "resistance government." You've given him delusions of grandeur, Jedi. But Balmorra is mine.
The people are with us, the corporations, too. Your occupation is over.
Balmorra shall be freed.
Ah, so you want President Galthe. Useless as ever--though a tad more decorative now.
What happens to a Sith who loses an entire planet to rebellion?
Afraid we'll win?
A few filthy rebels relying on a broken puppet. You're no threat to me.
That man is mine.
Stand aside or die, Sith.
Oh, precious. You actually think this fool president is of use to anyone?
Even thawed, he can't help you. Your government is doomed. How sad.
Why couldn't the president help us?
What do you mean?
Unfortunately, I lost all patience for teaching when you murdered my apprentice.
You broke my apprentice just to learn at my feet? I'm touched.
No more talk. She has poisoned Balmorra long enough.
This movement is larger than a single person.
We're not lost without him.
We're hidden across Balmorra. Thousands waiting in secret.
Then I shall cull the citizens of Balmorra.
Prepare for death.
Seconded. My followers demand revenge.
I'm not without mercy. I'll grant you a swift death, rather than make you witness your plans tumbling down.
